result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM Cases called: 20CT87/22CF231 Defendant Kevin J Vann in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Kevin J Vann.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony of Officer Perez. State rests. No witnesses by Defense. Arguments. Court makes findings, finds probable cause, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. State advises awaiting blood test results.
Further proceedings scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:14 AM Cases called: 20CT87/22CF231 Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin J Vann not in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Kevin J Vann. Counsel does not know why Defendant does not appear; Counsel had contact with Defendant this morning. Court passes case for Counsel to contact Defendant. 11:09 AM Defendant now appears. Counsel requests date for preliminary hearing waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin J Vann in court. Court reviews case history. Court examines Defendant on status of counsel. Court goes off record for clerk to contact PD 11:02 AM case recalled; same appearances. Court adjourns for Defendant to contact Public Defender's office. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
22R 006687  Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 6/23/2022.
Status hearing on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:00 PM. Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kevin Vann appeared in court in person. Copy of unsigned complaint provided to Defendant. Court reviews charges/penalties, finds probable cause and advises Defendant on right to Counsel. Defendant states will be contacting PD's Office regarding representation. State requesting $5,000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and set case for status on prelim.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Not to operate a motor vehicle while case is pending.
